summary: The Sapiens lens reveals the guest journey as progressive adoption of a collective fiction: from encountering the platform's myth (discovery) through gossip-driven stranger-assessment (search) to intimate trust evaluation (listing detail) to ritual commitment (proposal/acceptance) to fiction-reality collision (move-in). The seven UI elements synthesize this insight across all layers: a myth-first discovery hero that earns belief through evidence before asking for participation, an enriched listing card with three-layer gossip architecture for rapid stranger-assessment, a trust-first listing detail header that places peer testimony above platform claims, a pre-commitment contact-host message overlay that enables direct gossip before formal cooperation, a ritual proposal summary card with live price breakdown and ceremonial confirmation, an acceptance confirmation overlay with celebratory ceremony and immediate next-steps orientation, and a structured House Manual card system that codifies stranger-cooperation norms for the fiction-to-reality transition at move-in. Together they form a coherent system where the platform's imagined reality is demonstrated before demanded, trust is built through gossip and peer evidence rather than platform assertion, cooperation rituals are smooth and ceremonial, and the transition from fiction to physical reality is prepared rather than improvised.

elements.name: Myth-First Discovery Hero Section
elements.description: A hero section for the discovery page that earns guest belief by showing evidence of the platform's collective fiction before requesting any participation. Real listings with photos and prices are immediately visible, flanked by a social proof aggregate that demonstrates other strangers already trust this platform. No signup prompts, no preference questionnaires, no AI prompts appear in the first viewport. The search bar is present but secondary -- the guest can browse passively before choosing to refine. This implements the Sapiens principle that collective fictions sustain themselves through demonstrated reality, not persuasion.

visual_spec.layout: Full-width section. Top: headline + social proof row. Below: 3-column listing card grid (2-column on tablet, 1-column on mobile). Search bar sits between headline and grid, styled as a soft input rather than a prominent CTA.

interaction_spec.load: Listing cards fade in with 50ms stagger, social proof count animates from 0 to actual value over 600ms
interaction_spec.scroll: Additional listing rows load progressively on scroll without page navigation
interaction_spec.search_bar: Focus triggers a subtle border color change to --secondary-purple; typing filters the grid inline

elements.name: Gossip-Layer Enriched Listing Card
elements.description: An enriched listing card with three-layer progressive gossip architecture. The glance layer (always visible) shows photo, price, neighborhood, and a verification badge. The scan layer (revealed on hover) slides in availability status, host response time, photo count, and a save action. The design implements Harari's gossip theory: each data point is a trust signal that enables the guest to assess a stranger without meeting them. The hover transition uses shadow elevation and background warmth shift to create a clear distinction between scanning and engaged states.

visual_spec.layout: Card with 60% photo area and 40% info area. Max-width 360px. Border-radius 12px.
visual_spec.photo_area: Aspect ratio 3:2, placeholder gradient, verification badge top-left, photo count bottom-right
visual_spec.info_area: Price in semibold, neighborhood as muted chip, gossip row slides in on hover
visual_spec.hover_state: Elevation shifts to shadow-md, background shifts to warm off-white, gossip row animates in from bottom

interaction_spec.hover_in: 200ms transition for elevation and background, 150ms delayed slide-in for gossip row
interaction_spec.mobile: Long-press 300ms triggers expanded state, tap outside dismisses

elements.name: Trust-First Listing Detail Header
elements.description: The top section of the listing detail page, structured with trust-first information architecture. The host identity block (photo, name, verification badge, response rate) sits on a warm accent background immediately below the photo gallery. Below that, a review summary line with star rating and most recent review quote provides peer trust evidence before any listing description. This implements the Sapiens cross-activation principle: a past guest's testimony activates a future guest's trust more effectively than any platform assertion. The 'Contact Host' and 'Create Proposal' CTAs are always visible as sticky actions.

visual_spec.layout: Full-width. Photo gallery placeholder at top. Host identity row on accent background. Review summary below. Two CTA buttons in a sticky bar.

elements.name: Contact Host Message Overlay
elements.description: A slide-up message overlay that enables the guest to gossip directly with the host before committing to a formal proposal. The overlay shows the host's name, photo, and response time, with a text input and send button. This implements the Sapiens gossip theory: humans evolved to assess potential cooperators through direct interpersonal communication. The messaging channel reduces the 'cooperation vacuum' where the guest has interest but no low-stakes way to act on it. The overlay preserves the listing detail context behind a dimmed backdrop.

visual_spec.layout: Bottom-sheet overlay, max-width 480px centered. Host identity mini-row at top, text area in middle, send button at bottom.

elements.name: Ritual Proposal Summary with Live Price
elements.description: A pre-populated proposal summary card with a live price breakdown panel. The card pre-fills listing-derived terms (dates, schedule, price) so the guest confirms rather than constructs. The price panel updates in real-time as any field changes. The submit button uses the reserved gradient-purple treatment for binding actions, creating a ceremonial distinction from ordinary UI interactions. This implements Harari's incorporation ritual metaphor: the proposal is the moment dates and prices become an intersubjective reality shared between two strangers.

visual_spec.layout: Two-column on desktop (form left, price right), single column on mobile. Summary card on warm background with strong border frame. Submit button in gradient purple.
visual_spec.submit_button: gradient-purple-button treatment, reserved for binding actions

elements.problem_it_solves: The proposal form creates friction through redundant data entry, hidden costs, and authentication redirects. This pre-populated ritual form reduces the guest's cognitive burden and ensures the incorporation ceremony completes smoothly.

elements.name: Acceptance Confirmation Ceremony Overlay
elements.description: A full-viewport overlay that marks the moment the negotiable fiction becomes a binding agreement. After the guest clicks 'Yes, Proceed', the overlay appears with a ceremonial check animation, the host's name, the confirmed terms, and immediate next-steps orientation (House Manual access, move-in date). This implements Harari's insight that ritual moments require distinct treatment -- the acceptance confirmation must feel different from every other interaction in the product to mark the cooperation threshold. The spring-eased check animation is the only 'celebratory' motion in the entire guest journey.

visual_spec.layout: Full-viewport centered overlay on semi-transparent white backdrop. Check icon at top, terms summary in the middle, next-steps at bottom.
visual_spec.check_animation: Spring-eased entrance (only spring animation in the guest journey)
visual_spec.terms_summary: Compact card with confirmed dates, price, and host name

elements.name: House Manual Card System
elements.description: A structured, card-based House Manual that codifies the cooperation norms between guest and host for the fiction-to-reality transition at move-in. Four distinct section cards (Arrival, House Rules, Space Guide, Neighborhood) each use a warm surface background with a serif heading and section icon. Critical items (check-in code, emergency contact) use an info-blue highlight bar. This implements the Sapiens insight that cooperation beyond intimate acquaintance requires codified rules -- the House Manual is the lease's 'law book' that replaces personal knowledge with structured norms.

visual_spec.layout: Vertical stack of four section cards with generous spacing between them. Max-width 640px centered.
visual_spec.critical_item: Left border 3px solid --secondary-purple, background light purple tint
